Structs/ResponseEncodingOptions.html#/s:.name: useQuotedString
Structs/ResponseEncodingOptions.html#/s:.abstract: Use RFC 3501 quoted strings when possible (and the string is relatively short).

Structs/ResponseEncodingOptions.html#/s:.name: init()
Structs/ResponseEncodingOptions.html#/s:.abstract: Create RFC 3501 compliant encoding options, i.e. without any IMAP extensions.

Structs/TooMuchRecursion.html#/s:11NIOIM.name: limit
Structs/TooMuchRecursion.html#/s:11NIOIM.abstract: The maximum number of recursive calls when parsing data before throwing an error.

Structs/CommandParser.html#/s:11NIOIMAPC.name: parseCommandStream(buffer:)
Structs/CommandParser.html#/s:11NIOIMAPC.abstract: Parses a given ByteBuffer into a CommandStream that may then be transmitted.

Structs/SectionSpecifier/Kind.html#/s:11.name: complete
Structs/SectionSpecifier/Kind.html#/s:11.abstract: The entire section, corresponding to a section specifier that ends in a part number, e.g. 4.2.2.1

Structs/SectionSpecifier/Kind.html#/s:11.name: headerFieldsNot(_:)
Structs/SectionSpecifier/Kind.html#/s:11.abstract: All except the specified fields, corresponding to e.g. 4.2.HEADER.FIELDS.NOT (SUBJECT).

Structs/SectionSpecifier/Kind.html#/s:11.name: text
Structs/SectionSpecifier/Kind.html#/s:11.abstract: Text body without header, corresponding to e.g. 4.2.TEXT.

Structs/SectionSpecifier.html#/s:11NIOIM.name: complete
Structs/SectionSpecifier.html#/s:11NIOIM.abstract: Corresponds to no specifier, i.e. the complete message (including its headers).

Structs/SectionSpecifier.html#/s:11NIOIM.name: text
Structs/SectionSpecifier.html#/s:11NIOIM.abstract: TEXT – text body of the message, omitting the RFC 2822 header.

Structs/SectionSpecifier.html#/s:11NIOIM.name: headerFields(_:)
Structs/SectionSpecifier.html#/s:11NIOIM.abstract: HEADER.FIELDS – a subset of the RFC 2822 header of the message

Structs/SectionSpecifier.html#/s:11NIOIM.name: headerFieldsNot(_:)
Structs/SectionSpecifier.html#/s:11NIOIM.abstract: HEADER.FIELDS.NOT – a subset of the RFC 2822 header of the message

Structs/SectionSpecifier/Kind.html.name: Kind
Structs/SectionSpecifier/Kind.html.abstract: The last part of a body section sepcifier if itâ€™s not a part number.

Structs/QuotaRoot.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9.abstract: The raw bytes decoded into a UTF8 String

Structs/MailboxName.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.abstract: The raw bytes decoded into a UTF8 String

Structs/MailboxName.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.name: init(_:)
Structs/MailboxName.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.abstract: Creates a new MailboxName. Note if the given string is some variation of “inbox” then we will uppercase it.

Structs/MailboxPath.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.name: init(name:pathSeparator:)
Structs/MailboxPath.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.abstract: Creates a new MailboxPath with the given data.

Structs/MailboxPath.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.name: displayStringComponents(omittingEmptySubsequences:)
Structs/MailboxPath.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.abstract: Splits mailbox into constituent path components using the PathSeparator. Conversion is lossy and

Structs/MailboxPath.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.name: makeRootMailbox(displayName:pathSeparator:)
Structs/MailboxPath.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.abstract: Creates a new root mailbox. The given display string will be encoded according to RFC 2152

Structs/MailboxPath.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.name: makeSubMailbox(displayName:)
Structs/MailboxPath.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.abstract: Creates a new mailbox path that nested inside the existing path.

Structs/MailboxStatus.html#/s:11NIOIMAPC.abstract: Creates a new MailboxStatus. All parameters default to nil.

Structs/FullTime.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore8F.name: fraction
Structs/FullTime.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore8F.abstract: This is a partially-dynamic field, and does not directly represent

Structs/StoreFlags/Operation.html#/s:11N.name: add
Structs/StoreFlags/Operation.html#/s:11N.abstract: Add to the flags for the message.

Structs/StoreFlags/Operation.html#/s:11N.name: remove
Structs/StoreFlags/Operation.html#/s:11N.abstract: Remove from the flags for the message.

Structs/StoreFlags/Operation.html#/s:11N.name: replace
Structs/StoreFlags/Operation.html#/s:11N.abstract: Replace the flags for the message (other than \Recent).

Structs/StoreFlags/Operation.html.name: Operation
Structs/StoreFlags/Operation.html.abstract: What operation to perform on the flags.

Structs/Flag.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore4FlagV.abstract: Creates a new Flag that complies to RFC 3501 flag-extension

Structs/ESearchSourceOptions.html#/s:11N.name: sourceMailbox
Structs/ESearchSourceOptions.html#/s:11N.abstract: Array of at least one mailbox filter.

Structs/ESearchScopeOptions.html#/s:11NI.name: content
Structs/ESearchScopeOptions.html#/s:11NI.abstract: Array of at least one scope option.

Structs/Date.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore4DateV.name: init(year:month:day:)
Structs/Date.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore4DateV.abstract: Creates a new Date and performs some basic validation on the input provided.

Structs/TaggedCommand.html#/s:11NIOIMAPC.name: tag
Structs/TaggedCommand.html#/s:11NIOIMAPC.abstract: The tag, typically a mixture of alphanumeric characters.

Structs/TaggedCommand.html#/s:11NIOIMAPC.name: command
Structs/TaggedCommand.html#/s:11NIOIMAPC.abstract: The command to associate with a tag.

Structs/AppendOptions.html#/s:11NIOIMAPC.name: flagList
Structs/AppendOptions.html#/s:11NIOIMAPC.abstract: Flags that will be added to the message

Structs/AppendOptions.html#/s:11NIOIMAPC.name: internalDate
Structs/AppendOptions.html#/s:11NIOIMAPC.abstract: The date associated with the message, typically the date of delivery

Structs/AppendOptions.html#/s:11NIOIMAPC.name: extensions
Structs/AppendOptions.html#/s:11NIOIMAPC.abstract: Any additional pieces of information to be associated with the message. Implemented as a “catch-all” to support future extensions.

Structs/AppendMessage.html#/s:11NIOIMAPC.name: options
Structs/AppendMessage.html#/s:11NIOIMAPC.abstract: A collection of non-essential options, such as any flags to be added to the message.

Structs/AppendMessage.html#/s:11NIOIMAPC.name: data
Structs/AppendMessage.html#/s:11NIOIMAPC.abstract: Metadata for the data to be sent, such as the number of bytes.

Structs/AppendData.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore.name: byteCount
Structs/AppendData.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore.abstract: The size of the message in bytes.

Structs/AppendData.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore.name: withoutContentTransferEncoding
Structs/AppendData.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore.abstract: true if the message data is sent without a content transfer encoding, i.e. as binary data, See RFC 3516.

Structs/CommandEncodingOptions.html#/s:1.name: useQuotedString
Structs/CommandEncodingOptions.html#/s:1.abstract: Use RFC 3501 quoted strings when possible (and the string is relatively short).

Structs/CommandEncodingOptions.html#/s:1.name: useBinaryLiteral
Structs/CommandEncodingOptions.html#/s:1.abstract: Use binary content literals, i.e. ~{20} style literals as defined in RFC 3516.

Structs/CommandEncodingOptions.html#/s:1.name: init()
Structs/CommandEncodingOptions.html#/s:1.abstract: Create RFC 3501 compliant encoding options, i.e. without any IMAP extensions.

Structs/AppendData.html.name: AppendData
Structs/AppendData.html.abstract: A description of the data that will be sent as part of an append command.

Structs/AppendMessage.html.name: AppendMessage
Structs/AppendMessage.html.abstract: Metadata for a message that will be appended to a mailbox.

Structs/AppendOptions.html.name: AppendOptions
Structs/AppendOptions.html.abstract: Various options that may be added to a message when it is appended to a mailbox.

Structs/TaggedCommand.html.name: TaggedCommand
Structs/TaggedCommand.html.abstract: Represents a IMAP command that is preceded by a tag that can be used for command/response identification.

Structs/InternalDate.html.name: InternalDate
Structs/InternalDate.html.abstract: The internal date and time of the message on the server.

Structs/MailboxStatus.html.name: MailboxStatus
Structs/MailboxStatus.html.abstract: The (aggregated) information about a mailbox that the server reports as part of the response to e.g. a SELECT command.

Structs/TooMuchRecursion.html.name: TooMuchRecursion
Structs/TooMuchRecursion.html.abstract: Signals that a line was too complex and required too many recursive calls.

Enums/ModifiedUTF7/OddByteCountError.htm.name: byteCount
Enums/ModifiedUTF7/OddByteCountError.htm.abstract: The number of bytes given to the decoder.

Enums/ModifiedUTF7/OddByteCountError.htm.name: OddByteCountError
Enums/ModifiedUTF7/OddByteCountError.htm.abstract: Thrown if an odd number of bytes is given to the UTF-7 decoder.

Enums/ModifiedUTF7.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore.name: decode(_:)
Enums/ModifiedUTF7.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore.abstract: Decodes a ByteBuffer containing UTF-7 bytes into a String

Enums/ModifiedUTF7/EncodingRoundtripErro.name: EncodingRoundtripError
Enums/ModifiedUTF7/EncodingRoundtripErro.abstract: Thrown if bytes cannot successfully roundtrip through the encoder and decoder.

Enums/ModifiedUTF7.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore.name: validate(_:)
Enums/ModifiedUTF7.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore.abstract: Checks that a given ByteBuffer can rountrip through IMAP’s UTF-7 encoding.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: all
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: All messages in the mailbox; the default initial key for ANDing.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: answered
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages with the \Answered flag set.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: deleted
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages with the \Deleted flag set.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: flagged
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages with the \Flagged flag set.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: new
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages that have the \Recent flag set but not the \Seen flag. This is functionally equivalent to “(RECENT UNSEEN)”.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: old
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages that functionally equivalent to “NOT RECENT” (as opposed to “NOT NEW”).

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: recent
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages that have the \Recent flag set.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: seen
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages that have the \Seen flag set.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: unanswered
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages that do not have the \Answered flag set.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: undeleted
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages that do not have the \Delete flag set.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: unflagged
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages that do not have the \Flagged flag set.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: unseen
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages that do not have the \Seen flag set.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: draft
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages with the \Draft flag set.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: undraft
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages that do not have the \Draft flag set.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: bcc(_:)
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages that contain the specified string in the envelope structureâ€™s BCC field.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: before(_:)
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages whose internal date (disregarding time and timezone) is earlier than the specified date.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: body(_:)
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages that contain the specified string in the body of the message.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: cc(_:)
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages that contain the specified string in the envelope structureâ€™s CC field.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: from(_:)
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages that contain the specified string in the envelope structureâ€™s FROM field.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: keyword(_:)
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages with the specified keyword flag set.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: on(_:)
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages whose internal date (disregarding time and timezone) is within the specified date.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: since(_:)
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages whose internal date (disregarding time and timezone) is within or later than the specified date.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: subject(_:)
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages that contain the specified string in the envelope structureâ€™s SUBJECT field.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: text(_:)
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages that contain the specified string in the header or body of the message.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: to(_:)
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages that contain the specified string in the envelope structureâ€™s TO field.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: unkeyword(_:)
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages that do not have the specified keyword flag set.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: header(_:_:)
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages that have a header with the specified field-name (as defined in [RFC-2822]) and that contains the specified string in the text of the header (what comes after the colon). If the string to search is zero-length, this matches all messages that have a header the contents.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: messageSizeLarger(_:)
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages with an [RFC-2822] size larger than the specified number of octets.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: not(_:)
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages that do not match the specified search key.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: or(_:_:)
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages that match either search key.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: sentBefore(_:)
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages whose [RFC-2822] Date: header (disregarding time and timezone) is earlier than the specified date.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: sentOn(_:)
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages whose [RFC-2822] Date: header (disregarding time and timezone) is within the specified date.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: sentSince(_:)
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages whose [RFC-2822] Date: header (disregarding time and timezone) is within or later than the specified date.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: messageSizeSmaller(_:)
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages with an [RFC-2822] size smaller than the specified number of octets.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: uid(_:)
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages with unique identifiers corresponding to the specified unique identifier set. Sequence set ranges are permitted.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: sequenceNumbers(_:)
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages that match a given sequence set.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: and(_:)
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 3501: Messages that match all of the given keys.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: older(_:)
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 5032: Messages that are older than the given number of seconds.

Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.name: younger(_:)
Enums/SearchKey.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore9Se.abstract: RFC 5032: Messages that are younger than the given number of seconds.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: logout
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Returns the session’s state to “non-authenticated”.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: noop
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Performs no operation, typically used to test that a server is responding to commands.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: create(_:_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Creates a new mailbox.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: delete(_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Deletes a mailbox.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: examine(_:_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Similar to .select and returns the same data, however the current mailbox is identified as readonly

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: list(_:reference:_:_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Returns a subset of names from the complete set of all names available to the client.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: listIndependent(_:reference:_:_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Similar to .list, but uses options that do not syntactically interact with other options

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: lsub(reference:pattern:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Returns a subset of names from the complete set of names that the user has marked as “active” or “subscribed”

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: rename(from:to:params:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Renames the given mailbox.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: select(_:_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Selects the given mailbox in preparation of running more commands.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: status(_:_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Retrieves the status of the given mailbox.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: subscribe(_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Subscribes to the given mailbox.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: unsubscribe(_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Unsubscribes from the given mailbox.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: authenticate(method:initialClientResponse:_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Begins the process of the client authenticating against the server. The client specifies a authentication method, and the server may respond

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: login(username:password:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Authenticates the client using a username and password

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: starttls
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Begins TLS negotiation immediately after this command is sent.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: check
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Requests a check-point of the server’s in-memory representation of the mailbox. Allows the server to do some housekeeping.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: close
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Permanently deletes all messages in the selected mailbox that have the \Deleted flag set, and unselects the mailbox.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: expunge
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Permanently deletes all messages in the selected mailbox that have the \Deleted flag set.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: enable(_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Enables each listed capability, providing the server has advertised support for those capabilities.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: unselect
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Unselects the currently-select mailbox, and returns to an unselected state.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: idleStart
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Moves the server into an idle state. The server may send periodic reminder that it’s idle. No more commands may be sent until

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: copy(_:_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Copies each message in a given set to a new mailbox, preserving the original in the current mailbox.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: fetch(_:_:_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Fetches an array of specified attributes for each message in a given set.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: store(_:_:_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Alters data associated with a message, typically returning the new data as an untagged fetch response.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: search(key:charset:returnOptions:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Searches the currently-selected mailbox for messages that match the search criteria.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: move(_:_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Moves each message in a given set into a new mailbox, removing the copy from the current mailbox.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: id(_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Identifies the client to the server

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: namespace
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Retrieves the namespaces available to the user.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: uidCopy(_:_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Similar to .copy, but uses unique identifier instead of sequence numbers to identify messages.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: uidMove(_:_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Similar to .move, but uses unique identifier instead of sequence numbers to identify messages.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: uidFetch(_:_:_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Similar to .fetch, but uses unique identifier instead of sequence numbers to identify messages.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: uidSearch(key:charset:returnOptions:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Similar to .search, but uses unique identifier instead of sequence numbers to identify messages.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: uidStore(_:_:_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Similar to .store, but uses unique identifier instead of sequence numbers to identify messages.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: uidExpunge(_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Similar to .expunge, but uses unique identifier instead of sequence numbers to identify messages.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: getQuota(_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Takes the name of a quota root and returns the quota root’s resource usage and limits.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: getQuotaRoot(_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Takes the name of a mailbox and returns the list of quota roots for the mailbox in an untagged QUOTAROOT response.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: setQuota(_:_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Sets the resource limits for a given quote root.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: getMetadata(options:mailbox:entries:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: When the mailbox name is the empty string, this command retrieves

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: setMetadata(mailbox:entries:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Sets the specified list of entries by adding or

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: esearch(_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Performs an extended search as defined in RFC 4731.

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: resetKey(mailbox:mechanisms:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: When sent with no arguments: removes all mailbox access keys

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: genURLAuth(_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Requests that the server generate a URLAUTH-

Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.name: urlFetch(_:)
Enums/Command.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore7Comm.abstract: Requests that the server return the text data

Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Extension.name: digest
Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Extension.abstract: A string giving the body MD5 value.

Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Extension.name: dispositionAndLanguage
Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Extension.abstract: A Disposition and LanguageLocation pairing. LanguageLocation can be further expanded, the intention

Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Text.html.name: mediaText
Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Text.html.abstract: The type of text message, e.g. text/html or text/plain

Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Text.html.name: lineCount
Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Text.html.abstract: The number of lines in the message.

Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Message.h.name: message
Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Message.h.abstract: Indication if the message contains an encapsulated message.

Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Message.h.name: envelope
Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Message.h.abstract: The envelope of the message, potentially including the message sender, bcc list, etc.

Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Message.h.name: body
Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Message.h.abstract: The child body. Note that this may be a multi-part.

Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Message.h.name: lineCount
Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Message.h.abstract: The number of lines in the message.

Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Kind.html.name: basic(_:)
Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Kind.html.abstract: A simple message containing only one kind of data.

Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Kind.html.name: message(_:)
Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Kind.html.abstract: A “full” email message containing an envelope, and a child body.

Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Kind.html.name: text(_:)
Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Kind.html.abstract: A message type, for example plain text, or html.

Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart.html#/s:1.name: kind
Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart.html#/s:1.abstract: The type of single-part. Note that “message” types may contain a multi-part.

Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart.html#/s:1.name: fields
Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart.html#/s:1.abstract: A collection of common message attributes, such as a message identifier.

Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart.html#/s:1.name: extension
Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart.html#/s:1.abstract: An optional extension to the core message. Not required to construct a valid message.

Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Kind.html.name: Kind
Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Kind.html.abstract: Represents the type of a single-part message.

Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Message.h.name: Message
Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Message.h.abstract: Represents a typical “full” email message, containing an envelope and a child message.

Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Extension.name: Extension
Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart/Extension.abstract: Optional extension fields, initially pairing an MD5 body digest with a DispositionAndLanguage.

Enums/BodyStructure/Multipart/Extension..name: dispositionAndLanguage
Enums/BodyStructure/Multipart/Extension..abstract: A disposition paired to an array of languages.

Enums/BodyStructure/Multipart.html#/s:11.name: parts
Enums/BodyStructure/Multipart.html#/s:11.abstract: The parts of the body. Each part is assigned a consecutive part number.

Enums/BodyStructure/Multipart.html#/s:11.name: extension
Enums/BodyStructure/Multipart.html#/s:11.abstract: Optional additional fields that are not required to form a valid Multipart

Enums/BodyStructure/Multipart/Extension..name: Extension
Enums/BodyStructure/Multipart/Extension..abstract: Optional fields that are not required to form a valid Multipart. Links an array of ParameterPair with a DispositionAndLanguage.

Enums/BodyStructure/LocationAndExtension.name: location
Enums/BodyStructure/LocationAndExtension.abstract: A string giving the body content URI. Defined in LOCATION.

Enums/BodyStructure/LocationAndExtension.name: extensions
Enums/BodyStructure/LocationAndExtension.abstract: An array of extension fields that are not formally defined, but may be in future capabilities.

Enums/BodyStructure/LanguageLocation.htm.name: languages
Enums/BodyStructure/LanguageLocation.htm.abstract: The body language value(s) as defined in BCP 47 and RFC 3066.

Enums/BodyStructure/LanguageLocation.htm.name: location
Enums/BodyStructure/LanguageLocation.htm.abstract: A string list giving the body content URI as defined in RFC 2557.

Enums/BodyStructure/LanguageLocation.htm.name: init(languages:location:)
Enums/BodyStructure/LanguageLocation.htm.abstract: Pairs an array of language strings with a location.

Enums/BodyStructure/Fields.html#/s:11NIO.name: id
Enums/BodyStructure/Fields.html#/s:11NIO.abstract: A string giving the content ID as defined in MIME-IMB

Enums/BodyStructure/Fields.html#/s:11NIO.name: description
Enums/BodyStructure/Fields.html#/s:11NIO.abstract: A string giving the content description as defined in MIME-IMB

Enums/BodyStructure/Fields.html#/s:11NIO.name: encoding
Enums/BodyStructure/Fields.html#/s:11NIO.abstract: The string giving the content transfer encoding as defined in MIME-IMB

Enums/BodyStructure/Fields.html#/s:11NIO.name: octetCount
Enums/BodyStructure/Fields.html#/s:11NIO.abstract: The size of the body in octets. Note that this is in the encoded state, before any decoding takes place.

Enums/BodyStructure/Encoding.html#/s:11N.name: sevenBit
Enums/BodyStructure/Encoding.html#/s:11N.abstract: Represents 7-bit encoding, octets with a value larger than 127 are forbidden.

Enums/BodyStructure/Encoding.html#/s:11N.name: eightBit
Enums/BodyStructure/Encoding.html#/s:11N.abstract: Represents 8-bit encoding, octets may be in the range 1-255. NUL octets are forbidden.

Enums/BodyStructure/Encoding.html#/s:11N.name: binary
Enums/BodyStructure/Encoding.html#/s:11N.abstract: Represents binary data where octets of any value are allowed, including NUL

Enums/BodyStructure/Encoding.html#/s:11N.name: base64
Enums/BodyStructure/Encoding.html#/s:11N.abstract: Represents an arbitrary sequence of octets in a non-human-readable form.

Enums/BodyStructure/Encoding.html#/s:11N.name: quotedPrintable
Enums/BodyStructure/Encoding.html#/s:11N.abstract: Represents octets that mostly are printable characters in the US-ASCII character set.

Enums/BodyStructure/Encoding.html#/s:11N.name: init(rawValue:)
Enums/BodyStructure/Encoding.html#/s:11N.abstract: Creates a new Encoding representation. Note that the rawValue will be uppercased to make the type easily Equatable.

Enums/BodyStructure/Encoding.html#/s:11N.name: init(_:)
Enums/BodyStructure/Encoding.html#/s:11N.abstract: Creates a new type with the given String.

Enums/BodyStructure/Disposition.html#/s:.name: size
Enums/BodyStructure/Disposition.html#/s:.abstract: Attempts to find and convert the value for the common field “SIZE”. If the field doesn’t exist or is not a valid integer then nil is returned.

Enums/BodyStructure/Disposition.html#/s:.name: filename
Enums/BodyStructure/Disposition.html#/s:.abstract: Attempts to find and convert the value for the common field “SIZE”. If the field doesn’t exist then nil is returned.

Enums/BodyStructure/MediaSubtype.html#/s.name: alternative
Enums/BodyStructure/MediaSubtype.html#/s.abstract: multipart/alternative. For representing the same data as different formats.

Enums/BodyStructure/MediaSubtype.html#/s.name: related
Enums/BodyStructure/MediaSubtype.html#/s.abstract: multipart/mixed. Used for compound objects consisting of several related body parts.

Enums/BodyStructure/MediaSubtype.html#/s.name: mixed
Enums/BodyStructure/MediaSubtype.html#/s.abstract: multipart/mixed. Specifies a generic set of mixed data types.

Enums/BodyStructure/MediaSubtype.html#/s.name: init(rawValue:)
Enums/BodyStructure/MediaSubtype.html#/s.abstract: Creates a new MediaSubtype from the given String, which will be lowercased.

Enums/BodyStructure/MediaSubtype.html#/s.name: init(_:)
Enums/BodyStructure/MediaSubtype.html#/s.abstract: Creates a new MediaSubtype from the given String, which will be lowercased.

Enums/BodyStructure.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.name: singlepart(_:)
Enums/BodyStructure.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.abstract: A message that at the top level contains only one part. Note that a “message” body contains a nested

Enums/BodyStructure.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.name: multipart(_:)
Enums/BodyStructure.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.abstract: A message that at the top level contains one or more parts.

Enums/BodyStructure.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.name: Index
Enums/BodyStructure.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.abstract: Message bodies are indexed using SectionSpecifier.Part. Consider a multi-part message to be an n-ary tree. Each node

Enums/BodyStructure.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.name: SubSequence
Enums/BodyStructure.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.abstract: Because BodyStructure is a recursive type, a SubSequence is defined as Slice<BodyStructure>.

Enums/BodyStructure.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.name: startIndex
Enums/BodyStructure.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.abstract: The index of the first part of the body. Note that single-part and multi-part messages always have at least one part. IN

Enums/BodyStructure.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.name: endIndex
Enums/BodyStructure.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.abstract: The last index of the body. Note that this does not go into child nodes, but only considers sibling parts.

Enums/BodyStructure.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.name: index(before:)
Enums/BodyStructure.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.abstract: Gets the index before the given index. Note that this does not go into child nodes, but only considers sibling parts.

Enums/BodyStructure.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.name: index(after:)
Enums/BodyStructure.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCor.abstract: Gets the index after the given index. Note that this does not go into child nodes, but only considers sibling parts.

Enums/BodyStructure/Disposition.html.name: Disposition
Enums/BodyStructure/Disposition.html.abstract: A parsed representation of a parenthesized list containing a type string, and attribute/value pairs.

Enums/BodyStructure/DispositionAndLangua.name: DispositionAndLanguage
Enums/BodyStructure/DispositionAndLangua.abstract: Pairs a body Disposition with a LanguageLocation. An abstraction from RFC 3501

Enums/BodyStructure/Encoding.html.name: Encoding
Enums/BodyStructure/Encoding.html.abstract: Represents the body transfer encoding as defined in MIME-IMB.

Enums/BodyStructure/Fields.html.name: Fields
Enums/BodyStructure/Fields.html.abstract: Contains fields that are common across bodies of all types (basic, message, and text)

Enums/BodyStructure/LanguageLocation.htm.name: LanguageLocation
Enums/BodyStructure/LanguageLocation.htm.abstract: Pairs languages with a Location. An abstraction from RFC 3501

Enums/BodyStructure/LocationAndExtension.name: LocationAndExtensions
Enums/BodyStructure/LocationAndExtension.abstract: Pairs a location with BodyExtensionss. An abstraction from RFC 3501

Enums/BodyStructure/ParameterPair.html.name: ParameterPair
Enums/BodyStructure/ParameterPair.html.abstract: A convenience type to pair some key with a value

Enums/BodyStructure/Multipart.html.name: Multipart
Enums/BodyStructure/Multipart.html.abstract: Represents a multipart body as defined in RFC 3501.

Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart.html.name: Singlepart
Enums/BodyStructure/Singlepart.html.abstract: Represents a single-part body as defined in RFC 3501.

Enums/Access.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore6Acces.name: submit(_:)
Enums/Access.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore6Acces.abstract: Restricts use of an IMAP URL to sessions identifying as a message submission entity on behalf of the given EncodedUser

Enums/Access.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore6Acces.name: user(_:)
Enums/Access.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore6Acces.abstract: Restricts use of an IMAP URL to IMAP sessions that are authenticated as the given EncodedUser.

Enums/Access.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore6Acces.name: authUser
Enums/Access.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore6Acces.abstract: Restricts use of an IMAP URL to authenticated IMAP sessions, logged in as a non-anonymous user.

Enums/Access.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore6Acces.name: anonymous
Enums/Access.html#/s:11NIOIMAPCore6Acces.abstract: Allows non-restricted fetching of an IMAP URL, including non-authenticated sessions.

Enums/Access.html.name: Access
Enums/Access.html.abstract: Defines various access levels that may be used to fetch IMAP URLs.

Enums/BodyStructure.html.name: BodyStructure
Enums/BodyStructure.html.abstract: A parsed representation of the MIME-IMB body structure information of the message.

Enums/BodyExtension.html.name: BodyExtension
Enums/BodyExtension.html.abstract: Provides support for future extensions. Any future extensions to body fields must

Enums/Command.html.name: Command
Enums/Command.html.abstract: Commands are sent by clients, and processed by servers.

Enums/AppendCommand.html.name: AppendCommand
Enums/AppendCommand.html.abstract: A special case of a normal TaggedCommand. Users may send large amounts of data

Enums/CommandStream.html.name: CommandStream
Enums/CommandStream.html.abstract: Used by clients to stream commands to a server. Most commands are simple and sent under

Enums/MessageAttribute.html.name: MessageAttribute
Enums/MessageAttribute.html.abstract: These are the individual parts of a FETCH response.

Enums/ContinuationRequest.html.name: ContinuationRequest
Enums/ContinuationRequest.html.abstract: A â€œCommand Continuation Requestâ€ from the server.

Enums/ModifiedUTF7.html.name: ModifiedUTF7
Enums/ModifiedUTF7.html.abstract: IMAP uses a slightly modified version of UTF7, as documented in RFC 3501 section 5.1.3.
